column4: I messed up my grub and now can't boot. I have vista and ubuntu. I tried following the instructions here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows but I get a grub Error 2. help please!!

I messed up my grub and now can't boot. I have vista and ubuntu. I tried following the instructions here: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows but I get a grub Error 2. help please!!
use a live CD, mount your ubuntu partition and then use "grub-install" to reinstall the bootloader
Could you be a bit more specific? where do I have to install grub?
the "grub-install" manual page has some info.    It is something like "grub-install (hd0) --root-directory=/mountpoint/of/the/installed/ubuntu"
that will install the bootloader to the Master Boot Record of the first hard drive (hd0) then it will setup the /boot/grub directory to the root directory
What about the running grub part?
what?
in the various helps on the official ubuntu site it mentions opening grub doing root and setup
those steps are more low level, while "grub-install" is more like higher level, it should be recommended more.
Ok I did it... it says: This is the contents of the device map /media/disk/boot/grub/device.map.
seems correct
Ok thanks.. I try to reboot fingers crossded
wassup?
No luck >*
I still get Error 2 at stage 1.5 >*
if you have a Windows CD use that to install the Windows Bootloader, then repeat the steps I provided to reinstall grub.
This is the output of my fdisk -l http://paste.ubuntu.com/131761/
might read this at least http://www.uruk.org/orig-grub/errors.html
Yes it says "Selected disk doesn't exist" which is not very helpful :(
might be BIOS problem? Check your BIOS when the PC boots. But do that, reinstall the bootloader with Windows, then make sure it works, then reinstall grub.
Don't thinks so, but thanks. It woas working till I messed up something in grub
can you remember what you were messing?
what's that?
